subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] How to handle "er" and "ur" in QS
msgSnippet: Responding to my own email. I should have also made clear that I understand that some members have stated ligatures should only be used to make appearance look
messageBody:
Responding to my own email. I should have also made clear that I
understand that some members have stated ligatures should only be used
to make appearance look better, not to convey a different meaning.
However, my suggestion would not break this rule, at least for American
English. (I am not sure about other dialects.) In both "arena" and
"bird" you would use an "Ado" followed by a "Roar." In both cases you
could write the letters separately or use ligatures without breaking any
rule. You could also use a ligature for one and not the other and not
break any rule. Only, in the last case, the word might be easier to read.

Thought I needed to add that note of clarity. Time for bed for me.

Paul
Pipe Awl Loll
